full_text:
TIL that Error objects in #JavaScript will leak closures until you read `stack`. So don't keep them around.

In other words, everything in the closure at the point `new Error` was called, will stick around for as long as you have a reference to the error until you read `stack`. https://t.co/IkCF9Pist4

Thanks to @Janicklas, Next.js can now automatically inline Critical CSS ‚ú®

Feature is experimental and behind a flag, but we'll love to hear your feedback:

1. Add `experimental: { optimizeCss: true }` to next.config.js
2. Install critters@0.0.7 as a dependency

And that's it! https://t.co/v9UOVuiyZi

This can significantly reduce startup time. For example, if you're working on a single page of an app, there's no need to build other pages until you load them. üöÄ https://t.co/tR6109SlCZ

üî• Hot tip: Use Touch ID for sudo password. Edit /etc/pam.d/sudo to include `auth sufficient pam_tid.so` at the top. If use VSCode it'll ask you if you want to save a locked file. Select override and type in your password. 
You can now use Touch ID to verify sudo! https://t.co/CTwgdwXxlz
